intro: Aspilia hermogenesii, commonly known as the Hermogenesii flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a sturdy, upright stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its most striking feature is the bright yellow to orange flower head, which consists of numerous small florets arranged in a spherical shape. Aspilia hermogenesii is typically found in open grasslands and woodland margins, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
